children.text: For the first time since 2019, we can say that we have just wrapped up another PAX Australia. With that, our team scoured the entire PAX Rising show floor to check out all of the indie games. And through it all, we found 8 games at PAX coming to Nintendo Switch to keep your eye on.

children.html: <iframe width="200" height="113" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/kTythoYjs_s?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen title="Amazing Chicken Adventures - Xbox One Trailer - Piotr Rochala #indiegame"></iframe>

metadata.title: Amazing Chicken Adventures - Xbox One Trailer - Piotr Rochala #indiegame

children.text: Developed and self-published by a single developer,

is a madcap single-player or co-op 3D platformer where you play as chickens in an unfolding world. Collect hats to unlock the ability to use the items within the levels and push to eggs to the basket at the end - just don't break them (like I did).

Having met the developer on the show floor, it's clear that Piotr's inspiration was centred around making something fun for his children. Having released on Xbox and PC earlier this year (with a PlayStation release in 2023), it's a respectible feat that we're seeing more of in the indie space.
While the game can feel a bit clumsy at times, especially when you're needing to guide the eggs with nothing but your chicken's face, it is sure to create some laughs amongst friends and family.

children.html: <iframe width="200" height="113" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/n2wkObpn_94?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen title="Dros - Gameplay Trailer 2022"></iframe>

children.text: brings together a rustic, biopunk setting/aesthetic coupled with a
-style diorama level design. This is then complimented with a mechanic you may remember from classic 3D platformers like
series where you can swap between two characters, with the second being carried by the first but is able to separate from them to go forth and fit into tighter spaces.
When speaking with the art director, they mentioned that they're inspired by 80s movies that have a gruff feel to them. Couple this with the aforementioned rustic, biopunk setting, and that's

children.text: may seem familiar and if you've been following our content for a while, you may remember this game from its original title:
With the help of the publisher Asmodee Digital who often publishes both physical and digital versions of board games, such as
has the player(s) mix and craft potion brews to serve to customers. This is all set within a world that is inspired by medieval fantasy and Australian/Indigenous folklore.
Kendan and the Gem of Eru

children.html: <iframe width="200" height="113" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/64jh9Zgoi1M?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen title="Kendan and the Gem of Erú trailer"></iframe>

metadata.title: Kendan and the Gem of Erú trailer

children.text: Here's how the opening of my conversation with the developer of
Kendan and the Gem of Eru

is a turn-based RPG that embraces the limitation of the revolutionary hardware of 1989. With a passion for the handheld machine that shaped his childhood, James set out to create a game that would fulfill his lifelong dreams whilst being able to tell a story of a fantasy kingdom he's been working on for many years.
With the next generation of consoles pushing the boundaries of what video games can be,
Kendan and the Gem of Eru
reminds us what gaming is all about: fun and imagination.
Kendan and the Gem of Eru
is set to launch on PC (via a ROM) and Game Boy in 2023, but the developer did say that they'd also love to see the game ported to Nintendo Switch in the future.

children.html: <iframe width="200" height="113" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/xof8oPeGGGY?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen title="Spirit Mancer - Kickstarter Trailer"></iframe>

children.text: combines 2D action platforming with deck building RPG mechanics. Currently live on
, the demo we played was said to be pre-alpha, which was astounding to us considering how crisp both the gameplay and the art style was.
When speaking with the lead developer, they mentioned that they take plenty of gameplay and pixel art aesthetic inspiration from the classic
series. In addition, the character design takes a lot of inspiration from the JoJo anime series. So put those two together in a magical fantasy setting and you get
From the developer of the award-winning
, Brisbane studio Witch Beam are hard at work on another puzzle game and boy, this one has the promise of being something special!

has the player place directional and special movement tiles on diorama-style levels in order for the cute little character (who might be named Tempopo... I'm not sure) to make it through the end of the level safe and unimpeded.
has undeniable charm and with it being so polished and robust at such an early state of development (there's not even a trailer yet), this game is going to be one to keep an eye on.

children.html: <iframe width="200" height="113" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/AJ24FYkqXjg?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen title="TopplePOP Trailer July 2022"></iframe>

children.text: lacking all that much innovation since its initial creation back in the early 1980s, ArkimA combines colour block puzzle game classics like
and puts its own bungee jumping, physics twist to it.
With both co-op and party modes for players to enjoy,
is easy to pickup for everyone as it's party multiplayer mayhem that isn't too difficult to learn the basics. Couple that with a simple and addictive concept - quite like
can easily be the new block puzzle game that fans have been looking for.

metadata.title: Vlad Circus: Descend into Madness - Coming Soon! | Reveal Trailer

children.text: 2020 was a difficult year, but it also gave us the
best hidden gem of that year
from Indiesruption and Blowfish Studios. In just a few short months, we'll be getting the highly anticiapated sequel

In this new point and click adventure by Indiesruption, an arson attack puts an end to the circus and the tormented clown Oliver Mills must relive his chilling backstory while facing terrors to revive it.
